1.content:
Today was an ordinary Saturday. In the morning you got up, had a shower, got dressed, and lounged around the house for a while. Just after lunch you got a call from your sister, asking you to meet her at the mall. You found it strange that she'd asked you to the mall and were thinking of not going but since you really didn't have anything planned today, it probably wouldn't hurt to go to the mall and see what your sister wanted.

And so you found yourself walking to the mall, the sun beating down from the cloudless sky and you wishing you'd worn a hat. Along the way to the mall you passed by your best friend Tom's house. He was overseas visiting his girlfriend Annie and her family in Australia. The two of them had met just over a year ago when she was participating in an exchange program with a local school.

As you approached the mall you spotted Jake, one of your other friends, getting off the bus. Going over to him you greet him.

"Hey man, what's new?" you ask.

"Nah-much," shrugs Jake, "You?"

"Nothing really," you reply, "Shelly asked me to come meet her here and as I wasn't doing much I figured I might as well come and see what she wanted."

Jake nodded and said…

(for choice #3 another character is accidentally reaped and has to live a new life)
P.S. The story is still following Adam no matter what

"Maybe she wants to set you up with one of them bro," smirks Jake, "I hear they're pretty hot!"

"Yeah, that'll be the day won't it?" you laugh back, "Besides, it'd be weird going out with any of them. I'd be like me dating your sister!"

111.content:
"Hey," smiles your sister.

"Hey back!" you reply, uneasily.

"Hey girls!" smirks Jake.

"What's he doing here?" whispers Shelly in your ear.

"I bumped into him on the way over," you reply cooly, "What's this all about anyways?"

"Well, I think Paula'd be able to answer that better than me," smirks your sister.

You look over at Paula, wondering what this could be about. Paula was the tallest of your sister's friends. She was a good two inches taller than you even but you weren't a particularly tall guy. She was dressed in her usual modest, long sleeved T-shirt and jeans and was standing there staring at you, biting her bottom lip as though she had something she wanted to say but wasn't sure that she should.

"Alright, I'll bite," you reply brushing past your sister and over to Paula.

"Hey," greeted Paula nervously.

"Hey," you reply, "I hear you can answer why I'm here?"

"Heh, well… Uh, you know… This wasn't really…" she stuttered.

"Come on girl! You can do it!" prodded Patricia, another of Shelly's friends.

"Hah!" bursts Jake from behind you.

Both you and your sister glare at him.

"Ooh I love it when you do that!" snickers Jake, "You look just like twins when you do!"

"Oh put a sock in it," Shelly snaps.

"Adam," begins Paula again, "I… They… Um…"

"Or for Pete's sake Paula, just say it!" exclaims Linda, yet another of Shelly's friends.

"I'm trying!" returns Paula.

"Adam," Linda says to you, "What Paula here is failing so much at saying is that she has a crush on you. There, it's said now kiss or hug or whatever!" She then shoves you and paula together.

"Uhhh," you mumble, feeling Paula's breasts pressed up against you.

You try and step back but you are just in so much shock that you can't move your feet. Paula's face turns bright red and she resumes biting her lip.

"I knew it!" snickered Jake from the background.

Through her breasts you can feel Paula's heart beating furiously. Her face then turns white and she faints, collapsing into your arms. You set her down carefully on the ground and suddenly feel a twitch in the back of your head. Everything then goes black.

~~*~~


When you open your eyes you find yourself seated in a leather chair atop a cloud. Directly in front of you is a desk with what looks like an angel in a business suit seated behind it.

"Really sorry about the mix up," begins the Angel, "I guess his first mission should have been to someplace less crowded."

"Huh?" you ask, perplexed.

"Oh, sorry," replies the male angel, adjusting his tie, "Allow me to explain. One of our junior reapers was in the mall there to collect a soul and well he just sorta collected your by accident."

"What?"

"There was an elderly couple behind you and uh, when he swung his scythe he kinda grazed you too," explains the angel, "Now we are prepared to send you back to Earth but there are a few little complications."

"What complications?" you ask.

"Well, we can't put you back into your old body as, well, it's already been dead for a week."

"What?" you mutter, trying to stay calm at everything that is happening.

"So we'll instead create a new place for you to go. New body, new life, everything. The only other condition is that you don't get to be part of your old family."

"Why not?" you ask.

"Long story," he replies, "Now we've come up with a list of three new lives for you to take on. Remember, these are completely new identities complete with ret-conned backstories and everything. That means that while they never existed before now, everyone but yourself will believe they have always existed." He then takes some papers out of his desk and asks, "So which one do you choose?"

He then hands you the papers, each with the description of a new person on them.

Choice 1:
Female, 16, sister to Annie (Tom's girlfriend in Australia), Name: Kayla Bonn

Choice 2:
Male, 24, Older brother to Paula, Name: Nick Steam

Choice 3:
Female, 21, Jake's next door neighbour, Name: Sasha Winters

You sit back for a moment and contemplate your choices. It might be fun to be a girl for a while, but not forever. Also you still want to be in touch with your family, even if you can't go back to being one of them. That decided it.
"Alright, I'll be Paula's brother. She's a nice girl even if she had a crush on me", you say.
" Very well, Mr. Steam. Enjoy you choice.", said the Angel smiling contently.
Then everything went black.

~~~


A moment your vision returns. You find yourself staring at a blank white ceiling while lying on a bed.
You get up, a bit wobbly at first, and take inventory of the room. You appear to be in 'your' bedroom, with a wardrobe opposite to your bed and a small writing desk under a window.
On the third wall there is a full-body mirror hanging next to a crowded book shelf with what look like sport trophies on top.

You half stumble over to the mirror to see what you look like.
Staring back at you is a tall, well built young man in his boxers. He's tall, about the same as you were, and he, or rather you now, have a body bristling in sleek and powerful muscles.
"Not too shabby, if I say so myself," you mutter to yourself as you run your hand along your handsome jawline.

After a moment of examination, a sound from the hallway startles you out of your trance.
"Alright," you say as you muss your thick brown hair," first things first, I got to get dressed."
You slip on some clothes and notice a faint noise that appears to be from the next room over.
"That must have been what I heard before." You say to yourself.

Sitting back down on the bed, you ponder what to do next...
1112.title: Nick Steam is your choice

"So you choose Miss Winters Eh?" smirks the Angel.

"What?" you ask, hoping that this is all a dream but beginning to fear that it is all too real.

"Have a good life Miss Winters," smiles the Angel.

"No!" you shout out, jolt awake only to find yourself seated on a city bus, late at night.

Across from you a businessman looks up from his paper at you for a moment, eyebrow raised. You grin sheepishly and he returns to his paper. You look around the bus and see that aside from the businessman and yourself, two other passengers are present. You then notice the light brushing against the back of your neck of what you could only guess to be hair. You turn and look at the reflection in the window, coming eye to eye with the reflection of an athletic young woman with nicely tanned skin and curly blonde hair. You reach out and touch the reflection and the reflection's hand touches your manicured fingers.

You gently lift your right breast, shivering at the sensation. Letting it drop back into place you finally admit that this must be real as you'd never had a dream so vivid as this.

"Why'd I pick a girl though?" you postulate out loud in your brand new voice. This prompts the businessman to sigh and turn in his seat.

"Next stop, Carmichael Street," announces a voice on the intercom.

You recognize the name as it is the stop you'd get off at when you were going to visit Jake. The stop itself was just in front of his neighbour's house... Your new house.

11131.content:
You pull the cord and stand-up, noticing with displeasure how much different your centre of gravity now was. You then grab the purse you'd been sitting beside, assuming it to belong to you now, and go to the front of the bus.

"Have a good night Ma'am," smiles the bus driver as you disembark.

As the doors close and the bus drives off you stand facing your new house, too terrified by your new reality to move.

"Why me?" you bemoan, sighing, your shoulders slumping.

You scratch at an itch on your shoulder and walk across the grass to the front door. You then open the purse and flit through it in search of keys. You put the key in the lock and are about to turn it when you spot, out of the corner of your eye, the silhouette of Jake laying on his bed looking out the window at you. You smile nervously and wave which prompts him to jump back off his bed and out of sight.

You open the door and find yourself standing upon the threshold of your new house, your new home. You try to bring yourself to step inside but are afraid to do so. Afraid not because you are expecting danger ahead but because you realize that to cross this threshold is indeed a sign that you have truly crossed the threshold between your old life, as Adam Kent, and the new one laid out for you by that angel as Sasha Williams.

You toss the purse across the boundary as a first step but find yourself pushing back against the door frame as though fighting an unknown force. You feel exhausted and just want to sleep but are too afraid to make this one simple step towards your new life as a woman and away from your old as a young man. The wind blows through your hair, bringing to your nostrils the scent of flowery perfume. You brush your hair back into place, still at an impasse with respect to the doorway in front of you.

You take a step back and turn around. You then fling yourself at the door as though in an attempt to surprise your inhibitions and reach the warm bed you hope to find inside. You are surprised with what force you catch the door frame and push back, throwing yourself not inside as you had hoped but onto the grass of the front lawn.

Looking up at the stars you pray that this is all a dream and close your eyes. When you open them you do not find yourself where you hoped but instead where you hoped not to be, in the body of a woman, seated in the grass outside of her suburbian home.

As your fatigue grows stronger you slowly and gently drift off to sleep.

Your dreams are fitful and mostly involve memories of your childhood. You bolt awake only to find yourself laying on the grass under the bright morning sun, one hand clamped around a breast and Jake standing over you asking if you were alright.

For a few moments you lie there shivering, hand still tightly clamped, staring into Jake's eyes. Finally you release your grip and stand up.

"I'm fine," you murmur, unconvincingly.

"You sure?" asks Jake, his hand hovering just inches from your shoulder.

"Yeah, I'm sure," you say harshly, fighting back a strange and sudden urge for tears.

"Okay then," says Jake, backing away, "If you say so."

He then turns and runs to catch the bus that just pulled away from the stop in front of your new house. You watch him go, a lone tear trickling down your cheek, your chest still heaving from your jolting wake-up.

You go inside and make your way over to the fountain where Shelly, your sister, asked you to meet her. Along the way you receive a shock when Jamie, Jake's sister, runs up to you and gives you a big hug from behind.

"Hey Hay!" sheiks Jake's over-energetic sister.

"Hey Jamie," you reply, twisting out of her friendly hug to face her, "I just ran into Jake outside."

"Yeah, He's on his way to work at the gas station down the road," smiles Jamie.

"He got the job! That's good!", you reply.

"Yeah, I know!" grins Jamie, "And guess what?"

By how jittery she was, above her normal levels, you guessed that she had some really good news too. As the only thing she'd talked about all term was the application to a big college overseas you guessed that that she must have gotten accepted.

"I don't know, tell me," you humour her.

"They accepted my application!" she shirked, hugging you again.

"That's great!" you smile.

"Not only that but I also got a full scholarship that'll cover for my first year of tuition!" continued Jamie.

"Good for you!" you smile back.

"Anyways, what brings you to the mall on such a beautiful morning?" asks Jamie.

"I'm here to meet up with my sister," you reply.

"Awww, how cute!" giggles Jamie.

At this you blush.

"Relax! I just ink it's nice how you and your sister get along so well!" she smiles, "Anyways…"

As Jamie rushes off you finish you walk to the fountain where you find Shelly standing by herself.

"Hey Adam!" smiles Shelly.

"Hey right back," you reply, "What's this all about?"

"Well I was shopping with my friends when I realized that you and I never hang out anymore," grinned Shelly.

"We never hung out. Unless you count playing together when we both we kids and that was like ten years ago," you reply.

"See? It's long overdue!" smiles Shelly, "Besides, I got a promotion today and I felt like celebrating. You're looking at the new assistant to the director of transportation services for the City!"

"You okay?" you ask, freaked out a bit by how much Shelly wants to hang out with you.

"I'm fine!" grins Shelly, tossing her car keys to you, "So where do you want to go? And by the way, you're driving!"

"You're serious?" surprised at her allowing you to drive her brand new Aston Martin.

"Of course I am! So, where are we headed?" she smiles, leading you down the mall aisle towards her car.

"I guess we could go the the big arcade over at Smith Street and Weston Avenue," you reply.

"Okey dokey little bro," smiles Shelly, wrapping her aroma around your neck and resting her head on yours, "This'll be fun! Just me and my bro having a blast!"

"Sure, I guess," you reply, starting to warm up to the idea of a fun day with your sister.

Just then, as everything seemed to be going so well, you felt a little twitch in the back of your head and everything went dark.

When you open your eyes you find yourself seated in a leather chair atop a cloud. Directly in front of you is a desk with what looks like an angel in a business suit seated behind it.

"Really sorry about the mix up," begins the Angel, "I guess his first mission should have been to someplace less crowded."

"Huh?" you ask, perplexed.

"Oh, sorry," replies the male angel, adjusting his tie, "Allow me to explain. One of our junior reapers was in the mall there to collect a soul and well he just sorta collected your by accident."

"What?"

"There was an elderly couple behind you and uh, when he swung his scythe he kinda grazed you too," explains the angel, "Now we are prepared to send you back to Earth but there are a few little complications."

"What complications?" you ask.

"Well, we can't put you back into your old body as, well, it's already been dead for a week."

"What?" you mutter, trying to stay calm at everything that is happening.

"So we'll instead create a new place for you to go. New body, new life, everything. The only other condition is that you don't get to be part of your old family."

"Why not?" you ask.

"Long story," he replies, "Now we've come up with a list of three new lives for you to take on. Remember, these are completely new identities complete with ret-conned backstories and everything. That means that while they never existed before now, everyone but yourself will believe they have always existed." He then takes some papers out of his desk and asks, "So which one do you choose?"

He then hands you the papers, each with the description of a new person on them.

Choice 1:
Female, 19, Intern working for Shelly at City hall, Name: Ambrose Shellbourne

Choice 2:
Male, 7, family just moved into town (lives across the street from your family), Name: Joe Bintrow

Choice 3:
Female, 21, Jamie's room-mate overseas, Name: Amélie Bon-Patron

123.content:
When you arrive at the water fountain you find Shelly standing alone, a worried look on her face.

"What's the matter?" you ask.

"I was fired yesterday," whimpers Shelly, "And just now I think I may have hit someone else's car. I think it was my old boss' car."

"Oh my, what happened?" you ask.

"I was backing up and… and… and I didn't see it and…" shakes Shelly.

"I'm sure we'll be able to sort out the mess with the car. What happened at work?" you press, hoping she doesn't start to cry.

"I was just minding my own business when the Mayor came by to visit and I may have accidentally spilt an entire pot of boiling water on him. Then when they sent me away I tripped and unplugged the main switchboard for City hall. So many wires!" she mumbled through teary eyes, "So they fired me, saying that they couldn't afford another one of my 'screw-ups'." She then burst into all out crying, grabbing hold of you and pressing her face into your shoulder.

"Calm down Shelly," you say soothingly, "I'll talk to my boss about hiring you. The assistant manager position is open and I think he'll take my recommendation."

"I thought that you wanted that position," sniffled Shelly.

"You need it more. Here, I'll phone him right now," you reply, taking out your cell phone.

"Oh thank you so much Adam! I don't know what I'd have done!" exclaimed Shelly, wiping tears from her eyes.

"What's a little brother to do?" you ask, waiting for your boss to answer the phone.

"You're only two years younger than me you know," smirks Shelly.

After a short conversation with your boss he agrees to give Shelly the job. He tells you that he was planning on giving it to you but if you felt that your sister needed it more, and would do a good job, that that was fine with him.

"You start on monday at 4PM," you tell Shelly.

"You're the greatest brother ever!" shouts Shelly, pulling you into a tight hug, "With you around it's like I have both a little brother and a big brother all wrapped up into one!"

"Your welcome, now lets go see what kind of damage you did to that car," you say.

"Right this way," smiles Shelly, having mostly gotten over crying and joyously leading the way.

Outside you see that she had dented the bumper and broken one of the headlights of the other car. You get her to leave her licence and registration info under the windshield wipers and a note apologizing and a number to call for reimbursement for all needed repairs.

"Thank's so much Adam! I don't know what I'd have done without you!" grins Shelly, the tears gone from her pretty blue eyes.

"No problem," you reply, "Any tim---" You are cut off by a twitch to the back of your head and the world going black.

info.brief_description: You are accidentally taken by a grim reaper and are given a new life as compensation.
info.description:
Your name is Adam Kent, one day you go to the mall to meet with your sister and you (or someone else present) gets accidentally reaped by a junior grade grim reaper. That person is then sent back to the Earth as someone new (never before existed but people don't realize that they never before existed) and must now cope with their new life and new situation.

Rules:
1. only one person is ever accidentally reaped.
2. no killing off characters
3. keep personalities consistent
4. try for good grammar
5. Adam can always notice who is 'new' (in the case where he isn't the one who was reaped

Central Characters:
Adam Kent: 20, average guy, is friend's with his sister but the two don't normally hang out together
Shelly Kent: 22, mildly popular girl, is friends with Adam and relies on him more than he knows (may or may not be dating Phil)
Tom Timms III: 20, athletic guy, Adam's best friend and is Annie's girlfriend
Annie Bonn: 19, very intellectual, lives in Australia and is dating Tom
Jake Jenson: 22, average guy, friends with Adam and Jamie's sister
Jamie Jenson: 20, overly energetic girl, is Jake's sister and has applied to go to university in Europe
Phil Button: 23, strong and very handsome guy, (may or may not be dating Shelly, depending on the storyline)
